metadata.verification_standards: All tags verified with public sources including court documents, news archives, Wikipedia, and official records. Minimum 2 sources per sensitive classification (especially 'Victim' tags).
metadata.privacy_note: Victim tags assigned ONLY to publicly self-identified individuals or those who testified publicly. Anonymous victims excluded to respect privacy.
data_sources: Major news outlets (NYT, WSJ, CNN, BBC, NBC)

Jeffrey Epstein.notes: Convicted sex trafficker and financier. Primary subject of investigation.

Ghislaine Maxwell.notes: Convicted of sex trafficking in connection with Epstein. Former socialite and daughter of Robert Maxwell.

Virginia Giuffre.verification: Public self-identification, court testimony, BBC interview (2019), lawsuits against Prince Andrew and Epstein
Virginia Giuffre.notes: Principal accuser, founded SOAR nonprofit. First victim to give up anonymity (2011). Died by suicide April 2025.

Annie Farmer.verification: Testified at Maxwell trial using real name (2021), CNN coverage
Annie Farmer.notes: Only Maxwell trial witness to testify under real name. Abused at age 16 at Epstein's New Mexico ranch.

Maria Farmer.verification: Public statements, lawsuit against FBI, media interviews
Maria Farmer.notes: Sister of Annie Farmer. Filed first criminal complaint to FBI in 1996. Among earliest known victims to report.

Sarah Ransome.verification: 2017 lawsuit, Netflix documentary 'Filthy Rich', public interviews
Sarah Ransome.notes: Raped by Epstein and others for seven months. Featured in multiple documentaries.

Johanna Sjoberg.notes: Recruited by Maxwell while college student. Deposition mentioned high-profile figures including Prince Andrew.

Courtney Wild.verification: Crime Victims' Rights Act lawsuit (2008-2020), Congressional testimony
Courtney Wild.notes: Abused from age 14. Recruited 70-80 other victims. Landmark CVRA case exposed illegal non-prosecution agreement.

Michelle Licata.verification: 2005 Palm Beach investigation, Netflix documentary 'Filthy Rich'
Michelle Licata.notes: Abused at age 16. Part of original Palm Beach police investigation.

Jennifer Araoz.verification: 2019 lawsuit against Epstein estate filed under NY Child Victims Act, press conferences
Jennifer Araoz.notes: First lawsuit filed against estate after Epstein's death. Raped at age 15.

Sarah Kellen.verification: Court documents, 2008 non-prosecution agreement, media investigations
Sarah Kellen.notes: Longtime assistant to Epstein. Named as potential co-conspirator, granted immunity. Claims to be victim herself.

Emmy Tayler.verification: Court filings, defamation lawsuit settlement with HarperCollins
Emmy Tayler.notes: Personal assistant to Maxwell 1997-2001. British actress. Successfully challenged false allegations through legal action.

Nadia Marcinkova.notes: Complex role as both alleged victim and accomplice. Now commercial pilot and CEO of Aviloop. Granted immunity in 2008.

Adriana Ross.verification: Court documents, 2008 non-prosecution agreement, media investigations
Adriana Ross.notes: Former model, key assistant. Named as unindicted co-conspirator, granted immunity. Allegedly removed computers ahead of raid.

Lesley Groff.notes: Executive assistant to Epstein. Named as potential co-conspirator but never charged. Settled civil lawsuit out of court.

Larry Visoski.verification: Maxwell trial testimony (2021), CNN and NBC coverage
Larry Visoski.notes: Chief pilot for Epstein's private jets for 28 years (1991-2019). Known as 'Captain Bigdawg'. Key witness at Maxwell trial.

William Clinton.verification: Flight logs, Wikipedia, official statements, House Oversight subpoena (2025)
William Clinton.notes: 42nd President. Flew on Epstein's plane multiple times 2002-2003 for humanitarian trips. Denies wrongdoing and knowledge of crimes.

Prince Andrew.verification: Virginia Giuffre lawsuit (settled 2022), BBC interview, Wikipedia
Prince Andrew.notes: Duke of York, second son of Queen Elizabeth II. Settled civil lawsuit with Giuffre for undisclosed sum. Stepped back from royal duties.

Donald Trump.verification: Flight logs (7 flights 1993-1997), public statements, Wikipedia, multiple news sources
Donald Trump.notes: 45th and 47th President. Social relationship with Epstein 1980s-2000s. Claims falling out around 2007. No allegations of wrongdoing.

Bill Richardson.verification: Court documents (Giuffre allegations), Wikipedia, news coverage
Bill Richardson.notes: Governor of New Mexico, UN Ambassador, Energy Secretary. Alleged by Giuffre, denied allegations. Never charged. Died 2023.

George Mitchell.verification: Court documents (Giuffre allegations), news coverage, Wikipedia
George Mitchell.notes: Senate Majority Leader, Northern Ireland peace negotiator. Alleged by Giuffre, vigorously denied. NOT in black book or flight logs.

Les Wexner.verification: Wikipedia, CNN coverage, Town & Country investigation
Les Wexner.notes: Billionaire retail magnate (Victoria's Secret, L Brands). Only known financial client of Epstein. Gave Epstein power of attorney. Ended relationship 2007.

Leon Black.verification: Senate investigation (2023-2025), Apollo board review, Wikipedia, Bloomberg
Leon Black.notes: Apollo Global Management co-founder. Paid Epstein $170 million for tax advice (2012-2017). Resigned from Apollo and MoMA. Settled with USVI AG for $62 million.

Glenn Dubin.verification: Court documents, Wikipedia, Harvard Crimson investigation
Glenn Dubin.notes: Billionaire hedge fund manager (Highbridge Capital). Wife Eva dated Epstein in 1980s. Epstein was godfather to children. Denied Giuffre allegations.

Alan Dershowitz.verification: Wikipedia, court records, defamation lawsuit settlement (2022)
Alan Dershowitz.notes: Harvard Law professor, constitutional lawyer. Member of Epstein's 2008 legal defense team. Alleged by Giuffre, who later recanted. Lawsuit settled 2022.

Bradley Edwards.verification: Crime Victims' Rights Act case records, book 'Relentless Pursuit', news coverage
Bradley Edwards.notes: Attorney representing Epstein victims 2008-2019. Lead counsel in landmark CVRA case. Secured $290M JPMorgan and $75M Deutsche Bank settlements.

Jack Scarola.verification: Court records, NPR coverage, law firm website
Jack Scarola.notes: Attorney at Searcy Denney Scarola. Among first lawyers to prosecute civil lawsuits for victims. Represented Bradley Edwards when Epstein sued him.

Jean-Luc Brunel.verification: Wikipedia, NBC coverage, French court records
Jean-Luc Brunel.notes: French modeling agent. Founded MC2 Model Management with Epstein financing. Arrested 2020 on trafficking charges. Died by suicide in jail 2022.

Doug Band.verification: Wikipedia, flight logs (26 flights), Fox News coverage
Doug Band.notes: Former top advisor to Bill Clinton, co-founded Teneo. Flew on Epstein's plane 26 times. Claims he warned Clinton about Epstein. No allegations.

Chris Tucker.verification: Flight logs (2002 Africa trip), Wikipedia, Netflix documentary
Chris Tucker.notes: Actor/comedian (Rush Hour series). Participated in 2002 humanitarian AIDS trip to Africa on Epstein's plane. Denies knowing Epstein personally. No allegations.

Kevin Spacey.verification: Flight logs (2002 Africa trip), public statements, news coverage
Kevin Spacey.notes: Academy Award-winning actor. Participated in 2002 Africa AIDS charity trip with Clinton. Stated he didn't know Epstein. No Epstein-related allegations.

Naomi Campbell.verification: Black book, flight logs, unsealed documents, public statements
Naomi Campbell.notes: Supermodel. Appeared in black book and flight logs. Denied knowledge of crimes, expressed disgust at Epstein's actions. No allegations.

Marvin Minsky.verification: Wikipedia, Science magazine investigation, court documents (Giuffre allegation)
Marvin Minsky.notes: MIT AI pioneer, Turing Award winner. Received $100K research grant from Epstein (2002). Organized symposia on Epstein's island. Alleged by Giuffre, denied by widow. Died 2016.

Stephen Hawking.verification: Unsealed documents (2024), news coverage, conference records
Stephen Hawking.notes: Renowned physicist. Attended 2006 gravity conference on Epstein's island. No evidence of wrongdoing or knowledge of crimes. Died 2018.

Lawrence Krauss.notes: Theoretical physicist. Organized 2006 conference on Epstein's island attended by Hawking and other scientists. No allegations of wrongdoing.

Martin Nowak.notes: Harvard professor. Program for Evolutionary Dynamics launched with $6.5M from Epstein (2003). Continued facilitating meetings after Epstein's conviction.

Alec Baldwin.notes: Actor. Appeared in Epstein's contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing. Being in black book does not indicate culpability.

Michael Jackson.notes: Musician (died 2009). Name appeared in Epstein documents. No allegations or evidence linking to crimes. Died 2009 before Epstein case became public.

Mick Jagger.notes: Rolling Stones frontman. Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

Dustin Hoffman.notes: Actor. Appeared in Epstein's contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

Cameron Diaz.notes: Actress/model. Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

Leonardo DiCaprio.notes: Actor. Name mentioned in Epstein court documents. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

Heidi Klum.notes: Model/TV personality. Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

Bruce Willis.notes: Actor. Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

David Copperfield.notes: Magician. Appeared in documents and black book. No allegations of wrongdoing.

Ehud Barak.notes: Former Prime Minister of Israel. Visited Epstein's Manhattan townhouse multiple times. No allegations of wrongdoing.

Ralph Fiennes.notes: Actor. Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

Ted Kennedy.notes: U.S. Senator (died 2009). Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of connection to crimes.

Courtney Love.notes: Musician/actress. Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

Andrew Cuomo.notes: Former New York Governor. Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of connection to crimes.

Henry Kissinger.notes: Former Secretary of State (died 2023). Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

John Kerry.notes: Former Secretary of State, Senator. Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

Eva Andersson-Dubin.notes: Wife of Glenn Dubin. Dated Epstein for nearly a decade starting in 1980s. Testified about household manager's complaint. Denied allegations.

Alexander Acosta.notes: Former U.S. Attorney who approved 2008 non-prosecution agreement. Later Secretary of Labor under Trump, resigned 2019 over Epstein controversy.

Kenneth Starr.notes: Attorney on Epstein's legal defense team for 2008 plea deal. Former independent counsel (Clinton investigation).

Jay Lefkowitz.notes: Attorney on Epstein's legal defense team for 2008 plea deal.

Roy Black.notes: Attorney on Epstein's legal defense team for 2008 plea deal. Prominent Miami defense attorney.

Maxwell's Father (Robert Maxwell).notes: Media mogul, Ghislaine's father. British Labour MP. Built media empire. Died 1991 (before Epstein case). Included for Maxwell family context.

Steven Pinker.notes: Harvard psychology professor. Consulted on Epstein legal defense language (2007). Stated he was asked for linguistic advice on single statement.

George Church.notes: Harvard geneticist. Received Epstein funding, attended meetings. Apologized for association after Epstein's 2019 arrest.

Lisa Randall.notes: Harvard theoretical physicist. Attended 2006 conference on Epstein's island. No allegations of wrongdoing.

David Gross.notes: Nobel laureate physicist. Attended 2006 conference on Epstein's island. No allegations of wrongdoing.

Lawrence Summers.notes: Former Harvard president, Treasury Secretary. Met with Epstein during Harvard tenure. Faced criticism for accepting Epstein donations to university.

Joi Ito.notes: Former MIT Media Lab director. Received funding from Epstein, concealed extent of relationship. Resigned 2019 after revelations.

Seth Lloyd.notes: MIT quantum computing professor. Received Epstein funding. Expressed regret for accepting donations.

Shelby Bryan.notes: Telecommunications entrepreneur. Former partner of Anna Wintour. Appeared in black book.

Tommy Mottola.notes: Music executive (former Sony Music CEO). Appeared in contact book. No allegations.

David Koch.notes: Billionaire industrialist (died 2019). Appeared in contact book. No allegations or evidence of wrongdoing.

Richard Branson.notes: Virgin Group founder. Appeared in contact book. Released statement denying knowledge of crimes. No allegations.

Edgar Bronfman Sr..notes: Seagram heir and CEO (died 2013). Appeared in contact book. No allegations.

important_notes: Being listed in Epstein's contact book or flight logs does NOT indicate wrongdoing or knowledge of crimes
Many celebrities and public figures had contact information in the black book without their knowledge
Flight log appearances often relate to legitimate charitable work (e.g., 2002 Africa AIDS trip)
Only 10 publicly self-identified victims are tagged as 'Victim' - 100+ additional victims remain anonymous by choice
Tags reflect documented roles/occupations, not allegations unless verified by court records
Multiple tags indicate multiple relevant roles (e.g., Dershowitz: Legal + Academic)
All 'Victim' tags verified through court testimony, public statements, or self-identification
No speculation or unverified claims included in any tags or notes

verification_methodology.Victim_tag: Assigned ONLY to individuals who: (1) testified publicly in court, (2) publicly self-identified in media interviews, or (3) filed public lawsuits. Anonymous victims excluded.
verification_methodology.Politician_tag: Current or former elected officials, government appointees, or royal family members
verification_methodology.Celebrity_tag: Entertainment industry figures including actors, musicians, models
verification_methodology.Legal_tag: Attorneys, judges, legal professionals involved in Epstein cases
verification_methodology.Financier_tag: Hedge fund managers, investment professionals, financial industry leaders
verification_methodology.Associate_tag: Known close personal or professional associates of Epstein/Maxwell
